interpretation: Debt ratio. Higher values indicate higher financial leverage and risk.
Total operating cycle length. Lower is better.
Most conservative liquidity ratio. Only cash and equivalents.
Profitability before interest cost.
Payables period based on sales.
Asset coverage of liabilities. Values > 1 indicate positive equity.
Days payable outstanding. Payment cycle to suppliers.
Interest coverage ratio. Higher values indicate ability to service debt.
Permanent capital proportion.
Sales profitability relative to asset base.
Operating profit margin. Core business profitability.
Days company can operate without additional cash inflow.
Days inventory outstanding. Lower indicates faster turnover.
Days sales outstanding. Collection period.
Asset turnover. Efficiency of asset utilization.
EBITDA margin. Cash operating profitability.
Operating expense burden relative to short-term debt.
Operating expense burden relative to total debt.
Adjusted profitability including non-operating items.
Short-term assets coverage of all liabilities.
Gross margin adjusted for depreciation.
Alternative calculation of gross margin.
Operating profit margin.
